---
name: dignified-python-310
description: This skill should be used when editing Python code for Python 3.10-3.12. Use when writing, reviewing, or refactoring Python to ensure adherence to LBYL exception handling patterns, pathlib operations, ABC-based interfaces, absolute imports, and explicit error boundaries at CLI level. Essential for maintaining dignified Python standards.
---

# Dignified Python - Python 3.10-3.12 Coding Standards

**Status**: This kit is currently empty and reserved for future documentation.

Python 3.10-3.12 specific coding standards have not yet been documented. This skill will be populated with version-specific guidance in a future update.

For Python 3.13+ projects, use the `dignified-python-313` skill instead.

---

## REFERENCES

- Python 3.10 documentation: https://docs.python.org/3.10/
- Python 3.11 documentation: https://docs.python.org/3.11/
- Python 3.12 documentation: https://docs.python.org/3.12/
